intro: Bidens beckiana, commonly known as the yellow beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy stems, which are often covered in fine, bristly hairs. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, and the plant is often found in disturbed areas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
